headline: Time to Pay the Piper: Cuomo Targets Medicaid to Fill $6.1 Billion Hole
abstract: Gov. Andrew Cuomo wants to cut New York’s Medicaid costs by $2.5 billion.
lead_paragraph: ALBANY — Facing the worst budgetary crisis since the early days of his decade-long tenure, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Tuesday unveiled plans to seek billions of dollars in savings from what he described as the primary culprit: runaway Medicaid spending.
